Properties

Name Type Default
value String null

Sets the masked input's value.

Code examples

Initialize a MaskedInput with the value property specified.

mask String '#####'

Sets the masked input's mask.

Code examples

Initialize a jqxMaskedInput with the mask property specified. 

$("#jqxMaskedInput").jqxMaskedInput({ width: 250, height: 25, mask: '###-##-####'});
width Number/String null

Sets width of the masked input in pixels. Only positive values have effect.

Code examples

Initialize a jqxMaskedInput with the width property specified. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput({ width: '250px'});
height Number/String null

Sets height of the masked input in pixels.

Code examples

Initialize a MaskedInput with the height property specified. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput({ height: '25px'});
rtl Boolean false
Gets or sets a value indicating whether widget's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.

Code example

Set the "rtl" property. 

$('#widget').jqxMaskedInput({rtl : true});

Get the "rtl" property. 

var rtl = $('#widget').jqxMaskedInput('rtl');
theme String ''

Sets the widget's theme.

jQWidgets uses a pair of css files - jqx.base.css and jqx.[theme name].css. The base stylesheet creates the styles related to the widget's layout like margin, padding, border-width, position. The second css file applies the widget's colors and backgrounds. The jqx.base.css should be included before the second CSS file. In order to set a theme, you need to do the following:
  • Include the theme's CSS file after jqx.base.css.
    The following code example adds the 'energyblue' theme. 
    

    <link rel="stylesheet" href="../../jqwidgets/styles/jqx.base.css" type="text/css" />
<link rel="stylesheet" href="../../jqwidgets/styles/jqx.energyblue.css" type="text/css" />
  • Set the widget's theme property to 'energyblue' when you initialize it.
textAlign String left

Sets the text alignment.

Code examples

Initialize a MaskedInput with the textAlign property specified. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput({ textAlign: "right"});
readOnly Boolean false

Sets the readOnly state of the input.

Code examples

Initialize a jqxMaskedInput with the readOnly property specified. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput({ readOnly: true });
promptChar String "_"

Sets the prompt char displayed when an editable char is empty.

Code examples

Initialize a jqxMaskedInput with the promptChar property specified. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput({ promptChar: "." });

Events
valuechanged Event

This event is triggered when the value is changed.

Code examples

Bind to the valuechanged event by type: jqxMaskedInput. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').on('valuechanged', function () {var value = event.args.value;});
change Event

This event is triggered when the value is changed and the control's focus is lost.

Code examples

Bind to the "change" event by type: jqxMaskedInput. 

$('#input').on('change', function () {var value = event.args.value;});
textchanged Event

This event is triggered when the text is changed.

Code examples

Bind to the textchanged event by type: jqxMaskedInput. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').on('textchanged', function (event) { var text = event.args.text;});

Methods
maskedValue Method

Sets the editable input value without mask characters. For example: If your mask string is set to '(###)###' and you invoke the maskedValue method passing '4444' as parameter, the jqxMaskedInput widget should display '(444)___'.

Code examples

Invoke the maskedValue method. 

@param String, Number
$("#jqxMaskedInput").jqxMaskedInput('maskedValue', value);
inputValue Method

Sets the editable input value without mask characters. For example: If your mask string is set to '(###)###' and you invoke the inputValue method passing '4444' as parameter, the jqxMaskedInput widget should display '(444)4__'.

Code examples

Invoke the inputValue method. 

@param String, Number
$("#jqxMaskedInput").jqxMaskedInput('inputValue', value);
val Method

Gets or sets the value.

Code examples

Get the value using the val method. 

var value = $('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput('val');

Set the value using the val method. 

$('#jqxMaskedInput').jqxMaskedInput('val', 1242);
focus Method

Focuses the widget.

Code examples

Invoke the "focus" method. 

$('#widget').jqxMaskedInput('focus');
destroy Method

Destroys the widget.

Code examples

Invoke the "destroy" method. 

$('#widget').jqxMaskedInput('destroy');
